EM and F 1 scores.from sentence: Regarding EM and F 1 scores , FABIR and BiDAF showed similar performances .

are.from sentence:
In this section we analyze the performance of FABIR and BiDAF in the different types of question in SQuAD .
shows that shorter answers are easier for both models : while they reach more than 75 % F1 for answers that are shorter than four words , for answers longer than ten words these scores drop to 60.4 % and 67.3 % for FABIR and BiDAF , respectively .

best performance.from sentence: shows that both models had their best performance with " when " questions .

\" how long \" and \" how many \".from sentence: Together with " when " questions , " how long " and " how many " also proved easier to respond , as they possess the same property of having a smaller universe of possible answers .

\" how \" and \" why \" questions.resulted in: considerably lower F1 and EM scores
\" how \" and \" why \" questions.from sentence: In contrast to these , " how " and " why " questions resulted in considerably lower F1 and EM scores , as they can be answered by any sentence , and hence require a deeper understanding of the text .

Questions.from sentence: Questions which expect a " yes " or a " no " as an answer are also difficult because it is not always possible to find those words in a snippet from the passage .

shorter passages.from sentence: It is curious that shorter passages showed the worst performance for both models .
